org.jtrim.access

Interface AccessStateListener<RightType>

  • Type Parameters:
    RightType - the type of the right this listener can receive notifications of
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RightGroupHandler

    public interface AccessStateListener<RightType>
    The listener interface for receiving notification of changes in the accessibility of rights. This interface is intended to be used by AccessManagers to notify clients that a certain right is now available or not.

    It is not mandatory that an AccessManager implementation provides such a notification service but highly recommended to do so. However if an implementation provides this service it must fire events in the order they occur.

    A right can be in three states as stated in the documentation of AccessState.

    Thread safety

    Most implementation of this interface are not required to be thread-safe but an event provider (e.g.: an AccessManager) may define otherwise.

    Synchronization transparency

    Implementations of this listener are not required to be synchronization transparent however they must not wait for asynchronous events.
    See Also:
    RightGroupHandler

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onEnterState(AccessManager<?,RightType> accessManager, RightType right, AccessState state)
      Invoked when a right (or rights) becomes available or unavailable.

    • Method Detail

      • onEnterState

        void onEnterState(AccessManager<?,RightType> accessManager,
                RightType right,
                AccessState state)
        Invoked when a right (or rights) becomes available or unavailable. If a certain right implies other rights as well (such as with hierarchical rights) the new state is true for every such right.
        Parameters:
        accessManager - the AccessManager in which the given right is managed. This argument cannot be null.
        right - the right which has changed state. This argument can only be null if the AccessManager supports null rights.
        state - the new state which is true for the specified right (or rights). This argument cannot be null.
